```{r, fig.width=20,fig.height=20}

x=c(rep(-3,500), seq(-3,-2,length.out=500), seq(-2,-1,length.out=500), rep(-1,500), rep(1,500), seq(1,3,length.out=500))

y=c(seq(-3,3,length.out=500), seq(3,0,length.out=500), seq(0,3,length.out=500), seq(3,-3,length.out=500), seq(3,-3,length.out=500), rep(-3,500))

z=rbind(x,y)

x11()

plot(y~x, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))

for(i in 0:20) { #For loop for demonstrating shear. i = 0 to start since the directions specify that the matrix should be the identity matrix to begin.
  m2 <- matrix(c(1,0,0.025*i,1), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
  z2 <- m2 %*% z
  x2 <- z2[1,]
  y2 <- z2[2,]

plot(y2~x2, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))
}

for(i in 1:20) { #For loop for returning to the original image.
  m2 <- matrix(c(1,0,0.5-0.025*i,1), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
  z2 <- m2 %*% z
  x2 <- z2[1,]
  y2 <- z2[2,]

plot(y2~x2, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))
}

for(i in 1:20) { #For loop for doubling the size of the figure.
  m2 <- matrix(c(1+0.05*i,0,0,1+0.05*i), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
  z2 <- m2 %*% z
  x2 <- z2[1,]
  y2 <- z2[2,]

plot(y2~x2, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))
}

for(i in 1:20) { #For loop for scaling back to the original size.
  m2 <- matrix(c(2-0.05*i,0,0,2-0.05*i), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
  z2 <- m2 %*% z
  x2 <- z2[1,]
  y2 <- z2[2,]

plot(y2~x2, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))
}

for(i in 1:20) { #For loop for counterclockwise rotation around the origin, it calculates the rotation angle in degrees, then converts to radians, and then turns angle of rotation into a rotation matrix.
  d = (18 * i) * (pi / 180)
  m2 <- matrix(c(cos(d),sin(d),-sin(d),cos(d)), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
  z2 <- m2 %*% z
  x2 <- z2[1,]
  y2 <- z2[2,]
  
plot(y2~x2, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))
}

for(i in 1:20) { #For loop for clockwise rotation around the origin.
  d = -1 * (18 * i) * (pi / 180) 
  m2 <- matrix(c(cos(d),sin(d),-sin(d),cos(d)), nrow = 2, ncol = 2) 
  z2 <- m2 %*% z
  x2 <- z2[1,]
  y2 <- z2[2,]
  
plot(y2~x2, xlim=c(-10,10), ylim=c(-10,10))
}



```
